_header: As young Aurora with her crystal hale
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 213.
Versification: — sixteen-line stanza, twenty-four-line stanza — aaabcccbdddbeeeb, aaabcccbdddbeeebfffbgggb
_description: William Dunbar, ‘The fenȝeit freir of Tungland’ — two 24-line stanzas sandwiching five 16-line stanzas, all in tail-rhyme

Banna.First Lines:
As ȝung awrora with cristall haileIn orient schew hir visage
                    paile…
Banna.Last Lines:
…Sensyne I curss that cankerit rowteQuhair evir I go or
                    ryde
Banna.Attributed Title:
Ane ballat of the fenȝeit freir of tungland how he fell in the myre
                    fleand to turkiland (f. 117)

Asloan.First Lines:
AS ȝung aurora with hir cristall haleIn orient schew hir
                    wisage pale…
Asloan.Last Lines:
…And sum saturnus tukAnd evir þe tuchettes at him
                    tuggit…
Asloan.Note:
Imperfect: lines 1-69 only due to missing folios after 212; MS paginated
                    also, = pp. 436-438; 16-line stanzas written as 8-line stanzas; transcript by
                    Chalmers in Edinburgh,  Edinburgh University Library La.III.450/1 [olim Laing 450], ff. 6-7v.
Asloan.Attributed Title:
Off þe fenȝeit fals frer of tungland (f.
                    211v)
